intro: Mesembryanthemum perforatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features fleshy, often hairy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Mesembryanthemum perforatum is well adapted to dry climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
